title: Capitalism, Socialism, and Democracy
author: Joseph A. Schumpeter
summary: A seminal work that introduces the concept of 'creative destruction.'
content: A seminal work by **Joseph A. Schumpeter** that introduces the concept of 'creative destruction.' It's a deep dive into the dynamics of capitalism and its relationship with society.

title: In Search of Lost Time
author: Marcel Proust
summary: A monumental novel exploring memory, time, and identity.
content: Written by **Marcel Proust**, this is a monumental novel exploring memory, time, and identity. It's considered one of the most profound works of literature ever written.

title: Walden
author: Henry David Thoreau
summary: A reflective account of simple living in natural surroundings.
content: By **Henry David Thoreau**, this book is a reflective account of simple living in natural surroundings. It's a classic text on self-reliance and the importance of connecting with nature.

title: If This Is a Man
author: Primo Levi
summary: A harrowing memoir of his survival in Auschwitz.
content: A harrowing memoir of his survival in Auschwitz. **Primo Levi's** testimony is a powerful and essential read for understanding the human condition.

title: The Year of Magical Thinking
author: Joan Didion
summary: A poignant memoir exploring grief and loss.
content: A poignant memoir exploring grief and loss. **Joan Didion's** writing is sharp, incisive, and deeply moving.
